text:
When creating a package, I need a specific version of a dependency. I thought I did this successfully when I used `pkg> add ProtoBuf@v0.9.0` and it worked locally with all my tests passing. Building a Docker container using my package instead resolves to `ProtoBuf@v0.10.0`.

How might I specify the package version so it also resolves correctly in Docker?

elements.text: When creating a package, I need a specific version of a dependency. I thought I did this successfully when I used
and it worked locally with all my tests passing. Building a Docker container using my package instead resolves to

.

How might I specify the package version so it also resolves correctly in Docker?

text: Use a Project.toml, and add your compat constraints there

elements.text: Use a Project.toml, and add your compat constraints there

text: Btw <#C67EFTEF3|pkg-usage> is more appropriate for this

You also might want to include your Manifest.toml in your Docker image that will fully lock it down.
(this requires resolving your versions outside of docker first)
